sentences.sentence: less spending but without falling into austerity the european commission has invited member states to come back to budgetary discipline which means gradually leaving behind the period of generous spending of the previous crisis years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: The legally binding rules compel EU states to keep their public deficit below 3% and their debt-to-GDP ratio below 60%, thresholds that many currently exceed by a significant margin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13

sentences.sentence: In addition, the Commission won't trigger the excessive deficit process this year that could result in financial sanctions for countries that breach the rules, but it will do so in 2024 the biggest challenge is to start a fiscal consolidation phase after many years of heavy public spending because governments spent a lot during the pandemic then came the energy crisis and the russian aggression against Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: So governments, again, spent a lot on defense and also on supporting households and companies to cope with high energy prices.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: So basically, in the past three years, we had very large public spending. And, you know, somehow ending debt and starting a fiscal consolidation will be a major challenge, I'm afraid, for many countries in 2024.
